ygData.subject: RE: Re: What to buy?
ygData.msgSnippet: First: don t judge people too quickly Clarity, I know people with much better equipment that cured silk at lvl 20, and I am SURE they did not twink their
ygData.messageBody:
First: don't judge people too quickly Clarity, I know people with much
better equipment that cured silk at lvl 20, and I am SURE they did not twink
their character. Trading can be very efficient, especially on old servers
where some items are very cheap now.
Second: I think Shelza was speaking about that because Herrick said there
was nothing better than cured silk armor before planes, which is not true.
But I agree when you say he should not worry about that. You can be fine
with cured silk armor til level 30.

Tsin Suchiko
40th rank, Tunare.


-----Original Message-----
From: Clarity [mailto:roderick.duncan@...]
Sent: Friday, February 04, 2000 8:42 AM
To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
Subject: [EQ-Monks] Re: What to buy?


From: Clarity <roderick.duncan@...>

Shelza,

I'm sorry, but what are you talking about? Herrick is a level 12 monk
talking
about saving up scarab carapaces for 1.7gp each! Do you think this guy has
30pp to go buy a bracer of erolisi? or 100pp to get a silver-plated bracer?
Please tell me what armor better than cured even a level 18 can go get?

I'm just a little tired of people who are twinked telling new players what
they
should be wearing:

"oh, man, that cured hat sucks, go get a froglock crown"

There is a lot better stuff that Harrick can get, but he definitely
shouldn't worry
about it now. He has to get to 30 or so first.


Clarity Harvestmoon,
Karana

>There is a TON of armor better than cured silk, I think the only place on
my
>monk that is still wearing cured is my Cured Silk Ghi (cause I just LOVE
the
>way my female monk looks wearing it) but every other location has a better
>amrmor peice. Goto EQ Stomped and they have a special section on monk
armor
>and you can compare and contrast them, and see what you want to hunt for
>next.
>
>Shelza, 18th Karana
